oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Polk Motel
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a roadside sign for a historic hotel. The sign is a good example of a disappearing type of roadside sign that was used to attract customers.

The Polk Motel was built in 1947. The motel is named after President James K. Polk and the Polk family, early prominent citizens of Columbia, Maury County, Tennessee. The motel was utilized by travelers before Interstate 65 was constructed. It is a good example of the type of mid-twentieth century roadside motel that is disappearing from the American landscape.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motels; Signs (Notices)
